intro: Taeniocarpum, commonly known as the red sanders, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its small, deciduous leaves and distinctive, elongated pods that contain the seeds. The plant is native to parts of Africa, Asia, and Australia, and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Taeniocarpum species are often found in rocky soils and can tolerate drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important plant in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
